data.title: Hidden paradise in IRAN
data.meta_description: Esfidan Esfidan or espidan is a stepped village of Bojnourd County ,North khorasan province, Iran. (46km from bojnurd , 8HGF+H7 Efsidan) 8HGF+H7
data.text:
Hi @MohammadVh

I have just released your post from the Spam Filters. I would like to apologize for your post being marked as spam. Our filters run 24/7 and they can be a little harsh at times.

You can visit this article to learn more: Why was my Connect post marked as spam?

Thanks for taking part & have fun in Local Guides Connect!

Due to the volume of private messages Google Moderators receive, I do not read or respond to private messages. Please post publicly so others may benefit from your discussion. If you require urgent assistance, please tag a Google Moderator. Thank you!

Hi @MohammadVh,

Thank you for revealing this hidden paradise and inviting us to go there? The village looks so calm and peaceful. I was curious do tourists visit it often or it's reserved for locals?

Due to the high volume of private messages, Google Moderators receive, I do not read or respond to private messages. Please post publicly so others may benefit from your discussion. If you require urgent assistance, please tag a Google Moderator. Thank you!

Hello @MohammadVh,

Thank you for sharing your photos with the community.

What I found most interesting is that the roofs of the lower houses are the yards of the upper houses. I hope the neighbors are friendly with each other.

I agree that these flowers make everything look cozy and welcoming.

This village reminds me of the small stepped villages in Italy like Chinque Terre or Amalfi. Have you visited any other stepped village?

Due to the volume of private messages Google Moderators receive, I do not read or respond to private messages. Please post publicly so others may benefit from your discussion. If you require urgent assistance, please tag a Google Moderator. Thank you!

Hello @MohammadVh,

Thank you for sharing these amazing photos and making us discover such an incredible location. The place reminded me of the rocky Moroccan villages located in the High Atlas. I'm sharing with you a photo from there, hope you will like it.

Due to the high volume of private messages, Google Moderators do not read or respond to them. Please post publicly so others may benefit from your discussion. If you require urgent assistance, please tag a Google Moderator Thank you!

hello @RadieN

you're welcome , yes there is so calm and Quiet that people from other towns go there at the weekend, and they eat iranian "kebab"‚ù§ i suggest you try it .

No; every body can go and meet the Hospitable people.

hello @MoniDi

yes that's true, in Villages the people are really kind with each other(more than people in towns)

Chinque Terre , Amalfi , really amazing, the sea near the vilage make it different.. i'll save it on map for my future travels.

yes, for example in our province we have Ro'een stepped village, every time that i go here, i see tourists from foreign countries ; they eat local foods and thats interesting the villagers are fluent in other language like English because of this tourists.

.

other on is Masule , there is very very beautiful stepped village that i went ,1 years ago in Gilan province,Iran , in northeast of iran.

i will post more information about this place.
